Container.Name: Chivalry-MedievalWarfare
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Chivalry: Medieval Warfare and run it.
ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
Server Config: You find the server config in: 'appdata/UDKGame/Config/' (eg: the servername is located in: 'PCServer-UDKGame.ini')
You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

Config.Name: Game Parameters
Config.Description: Enter your game parameters seperated with ? and start with a ? (don't put spaces in between eg: ?port=7000?queryport=7010)

Config.Name: Extra Game Parameters
Config.Description: Type in your Extra Game Parameters seperated with a space and - (eg: -seekfreeloadingserver)

Config.Name: UDP1 - GamePort
Config.Description: UDP Gameport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

Config.Name: UDP2 - GameQueryPort
Config.Description: UDP Gamequeryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

Config.Name: UDP3 - SteamQueryPort
Config.Description: UDP Steamqueryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
